text:
Hello, everyone.
I just started to use HubSpot and I have some problems with my api.
I already success with get contacts api.
However, I try to add new contact with my app, then this error has occured.
```{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Any of the listed authentication credentials are missing",
    "correlationId": "ed02ebb2-0368-4527-8068-bec134fc7aac",
    "engagement": {
        "oauth-token": "oauth-token not engaged. OAuth access token not found in request header.",
        "hapikey": "hapikey not engaged. hapikey is not present in query params.",
        "service-to-service": "service-to-service not engaged. Metadata for service-to-service request not found.",
        "app-cookie": "app-cookie not engaged. App cookie is not present on the request.",
        "internal-cookie": "internal-auth not engaged. You can get a new internal auth cookie for host '<http://api.hubapi.com|api.hubapi.com>' by visiting following link from your current browser window: <https://tools.hubteam.com/login/host/api.hubapi.com> ."
    }
}```
Please help me with this error message.
Thank you so much.

Hi, I’m trying to get the user information for the current `access_token` I see there is a <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/oauth2/get-access-token-information|legacy endpoint> for it, but it’s v1. Is it going to be depracated? Is there another way to do it?
That is the current version of this call -- I don't believe they would deprecate it until they release a newer version.

validating incoming webhooks - I'm validating incoming webhooks per <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks/validating-requests> but there's once scenario where the validation logic doesn't work - when the incoming payload has an emoji character - has anyone dealt with validating incoming webhook data with emojis?

Hello people of the slacks!
I am trying to report a bulk of emails I’ve sent using an external transactional API.
I want these email messages saved in HubSpot, for each contact, in the activity log. So I tried the `/crm/v3/objects/emails/batch/create` endpoint.
I tried many different approaches, but it is not working.
Could anyone in this colorful community provide a set of working examples for this endpoint, so I can try? Please?

is there any way to keep a blog posts original publish date when creating new posts using the API? So far I've tried to keep the original publish date field the same but when I create posts they come in as drafts. If I then publish those drafts the publish date is set to today. Any ideas would be very much appreciated
I wonder if when I create the blog post I can also set it to a published status right away? would that keep the original publish date
looks like publishing them immediately during the transfer keeps the publish date—not ideal but this seems to work

Hello, I was wondering if anyone has had any luck displaying the owner's phone number from the owner's endpoint?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/owners>
